name: Harborth's conjecture
rephrased: Every planar graph can be drawn with straight-line edges where each edge has a whole number length (integer).
implication_form: If a graph is planar, then it can be drawn with straight edges of integer lengths.
explained: Harborth's Conjecture states that every planar graph admits a straight-line embedding (a drawing with vertices at points and edges as straight line segments) in the plane such that all edge lengths are integers.
related_conjectures: Four Color Theorem (related to coloring planar graphs, not directly embedding)
